summary.para: The CanRoute method queries whether a specified input pin can be routed to a specified output pin.

param.name: OutputPinIndex
param.para: Specifies the index of the output pin.

param.name: InputPinIndex
param.para: Specifies the index of input pin.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT values. Possible values include the following.

description.para: These two pins can be routed.
These two pins cannot be routed.

remarks.para: To route the pins, call the method. Output pins and input pins are both indexed from zero. To determine the number of output and input pins, call the method.

summary.para: The get_CrossbarPinInfo method retrieves information about a specified pin.

param.name: IsInputPin
param.para: Specifies the direction of the pin. Use one of the following values.

param.name: PinIndex
param.para: Specifies the index of the pin.

param.name: PinIndexRelated
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the index of the related pin, or –1 if no pin is related to this pin. The related pin is a pin on the same filter, with the same direction; it typically represents the same physical jack or connector. For example, a video tuner and an audio tuner might be related pins. Typically, if two pins are related, you should route them together.

param.name: PhysicalType
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives a member of the enumeration, indicating the pin's physical type.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: Output pins and input pins are both indexed from zero. To determine the number of output and input pins, call the method.

summary.para: The get_IsRoutedTo method retrieves the input pin that is currently routed to the specified output pin.

param.name: OutputPinIndex
param.para: Specifies the index of the output pin.

param.name: InputPinIndex
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the index of the input pin, or -1 if no input pin is routed to this output pin.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: No input pin is routed to this output pin.

remarks.para: Output pins and input pins are both indexed from zero. To determine the number of output and input pins, call the method.

summary.para: The get_PinCounts method retrieves the number of input and output pins on the crossbar filter.

param.name: OutputPinCount
param.para: Pointer to variable that receives the number of output pins.

param.name: InputPinCount
param.para: Pointer to variable that receives the number of input pins.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: The other methods take parameters that specify pins by index number. For these methods, output pins and input pins are both indexed from zero. Use the get_PinCounts method to determine the upper bounds for each.

summary.para: The Route method routes an input pin to an output pin.

param.name: OutputPinIndex
param.para: Specifies the index of the output pin.

param.name: InputPinIndex
param.para: Specifies the index of the input pin.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: Routing two pins causes the output pin to deliver data from that input pin. Only one input pin at a time can be routed to a given output pin.
Output pins and input pins are both indexed from zero. To determine the number of output and input pins, call the method.

summary.para: The IAMCrossbar interface routes signals from an analog or digital source to a video capture filter.

This interface is implemented by the Analog Video Crossbar Filter. The Analog Video Crossbar filter is modeled after a general switching matrix, with n inputs and m outputs. For example, a video card might have two external connectors: a coaxial connector for TV, and an S-video input. These would be represented as input pins on the filter. To select one of the inputs, an application would use the IAMCrossbar interface to "route" an input pin to the filter's output pin, by calling the method.
